question: Which of the two philosphies share the concept that the  universe is composed of two realities: purusa (consciousness) and prakriti (matter)?
explanation: It is believed in Samhkya-Yoga schools that the universe is composed of two realities in the Samhkya-Yoga schools: Purusa (consciousness) and prakriti (matter) whereby Jiva (a living being) is considered as a state in which purusa is bonded to prakriti in some form like  senses, feelings, activity and mind.
